pet.name: Be a Foster Parent
pet.description:
Please help.
Every month we have to tell callers we have no more foster home space available to save homeless cats—some whose owners say they will have to leave their cat at a "Kill" shelter because they can no longer keep them.
Email lm@mi.rr.com for an application to foster. If approved and you get a call, you can always say "Not at this time". We work with your schedule and we need backup, temporary foster homes at all times. We provide the food and medical care. You provide the space, love and attention.

pet.name: Adoption Application for Backdoor Friends Cat Rescue
pet.description:
This is the adoption application for Backdoor Friends Purebred Cat Rescue located in Farmington Hills, MI 2 ways to get an adoption application to us:
1) Copy the link below and paste it into your browser window. You can then complete the app on line, then click the 'Submit' button found at the bottom of the app. http://www.backdoorfriendspurebredcatrescue.org/contact.html
OR
2) Copy the blank application below and paste it into a word doc or print the application using the printer icon above. Fill it out, and return it to us via email or postal service:
Backdoor Friends Purebred Cat Rescue/248-308-2289 (catz) Email completed application form to Lm@mi.rr.com or mail stamped application to 35560 Grand River Avenue #305; Farmington Hills, MI 48335.
Application date:_______________
Name________________________________________ Address__________________________________________________________ City, State and Zip___________________________________________________ Telephone_________________________________Cell_________________________ FAX________________________________ Email________________________________________________________ Desired cat age______________Sex______________Fur style________________ How long have you been looking for a kitten/cat?______________________________ Is this pet for you______ or someone else (if so, for whom)?______________________ The primary reason you are interested in adopting a cat (Check all that apply.): Family pet/companion____Companion for other pet____Children’s pet_____ Barn cat___ mouser____ Gift_____Business pet____ Other______________________________________________ Number of animals currently living in your home: Cats_________Age(s)_______Sex____ Dogs________Age___________________Sex_____Are they spayed or neutered? _______ Pets’ names______________________________________________ ________________________________________________________________ ________________________________________________________________ Do they receive regular vaccinations?___________If not, why not? _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Name of Veterinarian_____________________________________________________ Veterinarian’s telephone number (Please name last one if you do not currently have a vet.)_________________________________________________________________ Describe the last pet and his/her name that you owned.__________________________ _____________________________________________________________________ What happened to dog/cat?____________________________________________ If you currently have other animals, have you ever introduced a new animal into the household?________If so, how did you do it and how did the resident animals react? ___________________________________________________________________________ Who will be the main caretaker for the cat?_____________________ _________________________________________________________ Are you aware that the average yearly cost of veterinarian care is $150-$200 per year? Yes_________No_________
Backdoor Friends Purebred Cat Rescue/248-308-2289 (catz) (Continued ) Page 2 What veterinarian do you plan to use for your new cat? ________________________________________________________________ How many people live in your household? Adults_____Children______Ages_________ How do the other members of the household feel about a new animal?_____________ ______________________________________________________________________ Will anyone be home during the day for the new cat? ___________________________ Does anyone in the household have any allergies to cats?_______________________ Where will this Indoor Only cat be most of the time? (circle one) Confined (Where)__________________________Indoors everywhere_________ (Basement, bathroom, run of the house, etc.?)_____________________________ Do you own _____ or rent_____ your home? If rent, does your landlord allow pets? Yes___ No___ Don’t know____ Name of Landlord __________________________ Landlord’s telephone number (required)____________________________________________________________ What will you do with your cat when you go on vacation?_______________________ What will you do with your cat if you decide to move?___________________________ What will you do if your cat sprays or has litter box issues?_______________________ ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ ______________________________________________________________________ How will you handle destructive scratching? ______________________________________________________________________ ___________________________________________________________________________ Who is your backup caretaker in case you are unable to care for the cat? Name Phone Number Email For what reasons would you consider returning the cat to BFPCR?________________ ___________________________________________________________________________ I acknowledge that the above statements are true and accurately reflect my feelings for adopting an animal from Backdoor Friends Purebred Cat Rescue. _________ I am over 21-years-old.___________
Signature_________________________________________________ (We reserve the right to deny an adoption for any reason at our sole discretion.) Backdoor Friends Purebred Cat Rescue Rescue telephone is 248-308-2289 (2289=catz) 35560 Grand River Avenue; #305 Farmington Hills, MI 48335 Reviewer’s comments:

pet.name: Gretzky
pet.description: Gretzky, NM, DSH, Brown/White Tabby, Dob: 10/2007 How smart is this little guy; He was found waiting by an office to be rescued. Well the stars aligned and a woman saw this little cat going up to people looking for help. So she helped. She called us and we took him in. He had a collar and a bell but no tags and no microchip. Obviously he was someone's cat at one time but he was dirty and disheveled and needed some TLC. He has been seen by our vet, tested negative for FIV and FelK, received his vaccinations and was cleaned up. He is named Gretzky for the famous hockey player, Wayne Gretzky, because of his roughed up look. You see, Gretzky has had some trauma in his life but he's not talking about it but we see the evidence of it. He is missing part of his tail, part of his upper and lower lip, and has arthritis in one of his knees. He likes to rub up against everything, purring away. He is very playful too .He doesn't want to be picked up or held. He is slowly learning to accept pets from his foster mom.This guy deserves a wonderful forever home. His special adoption fee is $75. Contact LM@mi.rr.com for an application. OR complete the on line application at http://www.backdoorfriendspurebredcatrescue.org/adoption-application.html

pet.name: J.R.
pet.description:
J.R., NM, DSH, DOB: 1/1/15 Two-year-old J.R. has been cared for by a neighbor of his original owner, who sent us this information about him. He is an affectionate, grateful lap sitter and deserves a forever home. When you read his story you will see why.
To date he has had no vet care, but on 5/26 I will be taking him in to be neutered, wormed and shots. Then 1 booster shot three weeks later.
J.R.originally belonged to our next door neighbor. At the time they had 6 other kitties, a dog and some reptiles. When I first saw J.R. last summer he had absolutely no hair, just scabs, was itching constantly and was emaciated. Knowing the hardship my neighbors have I asked her if I could feed him. She said yes. So I fed him quality food and he quickly gained weight. I applied flea/tick treatment and his hair grew back beautifully. J.R. continued to hang around our house, following us wherever we were in the yard. He no longer went back to the neighbors. As we have 4 indoor kitties of our own, we could not bring J.R. inside, so my husband built him shelter (what he's sitting on) that was insulated and I put a warming mat inside.
This sweet baby boy has the most awesome personality and if I didn't have a house full already, he'd be mine in a heartbeat. He's so loving and very personable. Loves sitting on our laps and at times, when we were standing still, he goes between our legs and turns belly up, just looking? up at us.
Our neighbors have given up ownership of J.R. as of last fall.
I hope this helps find this sweet boy a forever home, because he is so deserving of a good life. It breaks my heart what this poor little guy has been through, and I pray that someone will reach out and adopt him forever.
Thanks,
Chris Pierce (Redford, MI) 313-720-8745

pet.name: Finn
pet.description:
Two long-haired young black cats (born in 2016) named Finn and Jasmine are looking for a new home together. Jasmine and her brother Finn have lived with 1 family from the time they were kittens. Although the family has 3 very large dogs and 3 other cats, it was a very quiet home. One of their cats has never accepted Finn & Jasmine (especially Finn) and is very aggressive with them. The situation is getting worse and is upsetting the other pets in the home. The family has tried to confine Finn and Jasmine to one room but that has not worked. The family has concluded that it is best to surrender them so they can find a loving peaceful home.
Please call Cindy 248-755-4260 if you have room in your rescue or home to take in both of them. The family can hold on to them for a few weeks. They are spayed and neutered, up to date on shots. Vet medical records, pictures and a movie are available from Cindy upon request. Please contact her directly by phone or email as soon as possible. cltalerico@gmail.com

pet.name: Patty
pet.description: Patty,SF, White/gray, DSH, Dob: 5/2010 Patty came in with her sisters, Whiskers and Sophie and had 5 kittens shortly after her arrival. She is somewhat friendly and loves to be petted, but does not like to be picked up. She gets along well all the other rescue cats.

pet.name: Roxy
pet.description: Roxy, SF, Black, DSH, Dob 4/2012 Roxy is a nice little girl who gets along great with all the other cats in her foster home. She has beautiful golden eyes and distinct white markings. She can be shy at first but will usually come around to be petted or to play with her favorite toy.

pet.name: Jasmine
pet.description:
Two long-haired young black cats (born in 2016) named Finn and Jasmine are looking for a new home together. Jasmine and her brother have lived with 1 family from the time they were kittens. Although the family has 3 very large dogs and 3 other cats, it was a very quiet home. One of their cats has never accepted Finn & Jasmine (especially Finn) and is very aggressive with them. The situation is getting worse and is upsetting the other pets in the home. The family has tried to confine Finn and Jasmine to one room but that has not worked. The family has concluded that it is best to surrender them so they can find a loving peaceful home.
Please call Cindy 248-755-4260 if you have room in your rescue or home to take in both of them. The family can hold on to them for a few weeks. They are spayed and neutered, up to date on shots. Vet medical records, pictures and a movie are available from Cindy upon request. Please contact her directly by phone or email as soon as possible. cltalerico@gmail.com

pet.name: Pilar
pet.description: Pilar, NM, Orange/White Tabby, DSH, Dob: 7/2008 Polydactyl declawed front paws, Microchipped Pilar was pulled from a county shelter. He was turned in as a stray. He was underweight and needed to find out why. Was it that he was a stray? or because he's a senior cat? or is there a medical reason. We took Pilar in so we could find the reason, hopefully, a reason that can be addressed. He has been brought up to date on vaccinations and has tested negative for FIV/Felk. We also did a complete blood profile including glucose and thyroid check. No problem with glucose nor thyroid. Did a belly ultrasound and discovered his intestines are thicker than normal. He is not on any medication. He is doing well. Pilar talks and grumbles a lot! If he's not happy with the situation, he will surely let you know. He's quite funny when he grumbles. He likes to sit next to you and receive head and chin scratches. Not fond of being picked up. He qualifies for the senior adoption fee of $100. Submit an application on line: http://www.backdoorfriendspurebredcatrescue.org/adoption-application.html

pet.name: Luna
pet.description: Luna is incredibly vocal and talks back with frequent and loud meows. She is friendly, playful (plays fetch), and enjoys being petted. She also LOVES to be brushed. She does NOT love being picked up but will crawl into your lap for a moment or two for quick affection but is not a 'lap cat'. She enjoys human companionship and is usually laying nearby. She consistently uses her scratching post and is uses the litter box. She eats dry food but does not show interest in wet food.

pet.name: Mouse
pet.description:
Mouse, senior female, loves laptime.
***This is a Courtesy Posting. The person that has all your answers is Beth who can be reached at baeriksson@yahoo.com or by phone248.497.2817 ***
Mouse likes to lay on your lap and be petted. She is very gentle and will Meow at you to pet her.
Mouse, Midnight & Sahara's owner passed away and now need someone who will just love them the rest of their lives. These 3 are all the same age, brother and 2 sisters. They were born on 6/1/2001 so they are older and pretty much like to lay around and be petted.
***This is a Courtesy Posting. The person that has all your answers is Beth who can be reached at baeriksson@yahoo.com or by phone248.497.2817 ***

pet.name: Sahara
pet.description:
Sahara, senior female,
***This is a Courtesy Posting. The person that has all your answers is Beth who can be reached at baeriksson@yahoo.com or by phone 248.497.2817 ***
Sahara likes to be brushed and will lay in the same room with you or next to you. She wants to be near you but not necessarily on your lap.
Mouse, Midnight & Sahara's owner passed away and now need someone who will just love them the rest of their lives. These 3 are all the same age, brother and 2 sisters. They were born on 6/1/2001 so they are older and pretty much like to lay around and be petted.
***This is a Courtesy Posting. The person that has all your answers is Beth who can be reached at baeriksson@yahoo.com or by phone248.497.2817 ***

pet.name: Midnight
pet.description:
Midnight, black domestic short hair, senior
***This is a Courtesy Posting. The person that has all your answers is Beth who can be reached at baeriksson@yahoo.com or by phone 248.497.2817 ***
Midnight, he is a big boy and is very very gentle too. He likes to be brushed and will lay by you but is very quiet and a little shy.
Mouse, Midnight & Sahara's owner passed away and now need someone who will just love them the rest of their lives. These 3 are all the same age, brother and 2 sisters. They were born on 6/1/2001 so they are older and pretty much like to lay around and be petted.
***This is a Courtesy Posting. The person that has all your answers is Beth who can be reached at baeriksson@yahoo.com or by phone 248.497.2817 ***

pet.name: Sally
pet.description: Sally is calm, even-tempered, affectionate and playful. She is four and a half years old according to the vet records. She is white with brown tabby spots, and weighs about 14 pounds. Her rabies vaccination and FRTC/C are due to be renewed 4/10/18. She adjusted quickly to all the changes. (See below about her owner passing away.) I believe she thinks she owns our apartment! Neither cat has demonstrated any destructive activity (like clawing furniture), and they both are using the cardboard cat scratcher I picked up for them. They both are fastidious about using the litter box. They are doing their afternoon naps now. I will try to get some photos of them tonight or tomorrow to send to you. If you are able to accommodate them, I think they will make fine pets. Sally seems to dominate Palmer a bit, so he might do OK if he were an only cat or with a less dominant cat. They had been together for about two years. Sally and Palmer were rescued after their owner passed away. Palmer and Sally are microchipped, FelK and FIV negative. If you are interested in Sally and/or Palmer, please contact Joyce at jmunro7att.net Phone number 248-432-7195. Please explain that you saw their posting on Petfinder.

pet.name: Palmer
pet.description: This is a courtesy post for a caller named Joyce. Please contact her directly if you are interested. She said, The cats (Palmer and Sally) came to me a couple of weeks ago through a death in the family. The police had taken them to the Humane Society of Huron Valley outside of Ann Arbor on 3/7/18. When the family was notified of the death, I was elected to pick up the cats and find them good homes. None of the family members is in a position to take them permanently. Both cats are chipped, and the HSHV changed the owner's name on them from the decedent's to my name before I took them home on 3/8/18. Both cats had been altered some time ago. Both tested negative for FELV on 3/7/18. They are both indoors only now and sweet and playful. > I was able to get some veterinary records for them on 3/24/18. They had been patients at the Ann Arbor Cat Clinic (734-973-9090). > The male cat is named Palmer. The vet records I have show that he was estimated to be about a year old when adopted in September 2008, which would make him about 10 and 1/2 years old now. He is all white, with fluffy, long fur and yellow eyes, quite striking actually. He is not a Persian. His FVRCP vaccine was due 8/1/17, and his rabies shot was due 11/8/17. He had been diagnosed with urinary problems and is on Royal Canin Urinary SO. In the time we've had him, he has shown no problem with this, eating well, eliminating well, and drinking adequate water. It took him a couple of days to settle down after all the changes he'd been through, but he is affectionate and playful. He is also a big guy, tall and weighing 15 pounds. Joyce's email address is jmunro7@att.net. 248-432-7195

pet.name: Ethel
pet.description: Ethel is a 6 year old kitty with as colorful of a past as her beautiful, colorful calico coat. She started her life as a feral kitten, hence the tipped ear after she was spayed, and was befriended by a 90 year old Good Samaritan who was determined to tame this little kitten and make her into a house companion. When the owner passed away, the cat needed a place to go so we opened our rescue to her. Ethel is an independent girl, but when she wishes, she is happy to find her way onto a waiting lap for some petting. Do you think your home may be the one for Ethel? If it is, the adoption fee will be waived. We just want Ethel to again have a home to call her own! Give us a call at 248.344.0181 (no emails!) and we can talk about Ethel. If we are unable to answer at that time, please leave your phone number with a message and your call will be returned. Thanks!

pet.name: Rita
pet.description:
I am a survivor of Hurricane Maria.
I am a very unique kitty, just look at my face! My eyes can tell you stories.
I am very aloof kitty and I love life!!
I can be at little strange at times and tend to look at the world in a different view... upside down.
I am not a huge fan of other kitties, but I can learn to get along.
All personality traits will come to surface once in a new home. Please allow me time and patience to show you that I can be your new family member.

pet.name: Khaleesi
pet.description: Khaleesi, also called Olive, came to Cat's Cradle with her 6 kittens. They have found homes, so now she needs one. Khaleesi is about 1.5 years old, is spayed and FLV/FIV negative. She is friendly and affectionate once she has settled in. We think she would do best with another cat. Adoption fee is $100 cash or check. Please email for an application: catcr8l@gmail.com

pet.name: Mystic
pet.description: Mystic's owner recently died and she and her friend, Saber, are looking for a new home together. Mystic and Saber are both about 7 years old, altered and FLV/FIV negative. Very nice cats! Not crazy about dogs. Adoption fee is $200 cash or check for the pair. Please email for an application: catcr8l@gmail.com

pet.name: Saber
pet.description: Saber's owner recently died and he and his friend, Mystic, are looking for a new home together. Saber and Mystic are both about 7 years old, altered and FLV/FIV negative. Very nice cats! Not crazy about dogs. Adoption fee is $200 cash or check for the pair. Please email for an application: catcr8l@gmail.com

pet.name: Tammy Sue
pet.description: Tammy Sue was part of a trap, neuter, return program but was just too nice to put back outside. She is about 8 months old, spayed and FLV/FIV negative. She does have a tipped left ear as is done with TNR. Tammy Sue is good with other cats and would do best in a home with another cat. Still learning about life inside with people and dogs. Please email for an application: catcr8l@gmail.com. Adoption fee is $100 cash or check.

pet.name: Pete
pet.description: Pete is an extra-awesome cat! He's handsome, very social, and likes making friends with everyone he meets. He has a soft coat and beautiful golden eyes. Pete can't wait to find a forever home and shower his new family with love! You can meet Pete at our Pet Smart Adoption Center in Northville.

pet.name: Louise
pet.description: Beautiful Louise came to us because she didn't get along with the other cats in her home. She just hid in the basement, which is no fun at all. She's very nice and likes getting attention from people. She especially loves getting her beautiful, glowing white fur combed. Louise is hoping for a quieter home with a loving person to take care of her, and no other cats to scare her.

pet.name: Schroeder
pet.description: Schroeder is a very nice and friendly boy. He's a people-oriented cat, and loves to get pets and attention. If he sees someone walk by, he'll meow to politely ask for someone to come visit him. He has a handsome white and black coat, and an adorable pink nose with white whiskers. Schroeder will be a happy boy on the day he goes to his forever home! You can meet Schroeder at our Pet Smart Adoption Center in Northville.

pet.name: Jetta
pet.description: Beautiful Jetta has jet black fur and big, expressive eyes. She's a nice girl who likes hanging out with people, and she likes to "talk" to you when you spend time with her. Jetta is a pretty relaxed girl who is on the lookout for a home where she can stretch out, look out the window, be taken care of, and enjoy life! You can meet Jetta at our Pet Smart Adoption Center in Northville.
